definition: Ptolemy, kings of Egypt after the partition of Alexander the Great's Empire in 305 BC/Ptolemy or Claudius Ptolemaeus (c. 90-c. 168), Alexandrian Greek astronomer, mathematician and geographer, author of the Almagest 天文學大成|天文学大成/see also 托勒玫[Tuo1 le4 mei2]
prop/support (for weight)/rest (e.g. arm rest)/thanks to/to hold in one's hand/to support in one's palm/to give/to base/to commit/to set/torr (unit of pressure)
to trust/to entrust/to be entrusted with/to act as trustee
to strap tightly/to bind
to rein in/to compel/to force/to carve/to engrave/(literary) to command/to lead/bridle/(physics) abbr. for 勒克斯[le4 ke4 si1], lux
surname Mi/name of an ancient state
secret/confidential/close/thick/dense
Ptolemy, kings of Egypt after the partition of Alexander the Great's Empire in 305 BC

sentences.english: This family is known as the Ptolemies.
Ptolemaic Egypt was an important historical period during the development of ancient Egypt.
sentences.chinese: 托勒密王朝是古代埃及史上一个重要历史时期。

sentences.english: This situation is reminiscent of the (incorrect) Ptolemaic theory of planetary motion first developed by the ancient Greeks.
sentences.chinese: 这种状况不禁让人想起错误的托勒密行星运动理论。

sentences.english: But during the era of the Ptolemy’s, the role of Greek women had changed.
sentences.chinese: 但在托勒密王朝时期，希腊妇女的角色改变了。

sentences.english: Ptolemy's geocentric theory has been taken as an example of a paradigm.
sentences.chinese: 托勒密的地心说已被认为是一个范式例子。

sentences.english: Text at the upper right explains the movement of the planets according to the Ptolemaic system.
sentences.chinese: 右上角的文字解释了托勒密系统的行星运动。

sentences.english: That model is far more successful than Ptolemy's epicycles.
sentences.chinese: 这个模型远远要比托勒密的本轮要成功得多。

sentences.english: He was succeeded by his son, Ptolemy II Philadelphus.
sentences.chinese: 由儿子托勒密二世继承了他的王位。

sentences.english: For your information, they work for Ptolemy XIII .
sentences.chinese: 以你所知道的来看，他们是为托勒密做事。
